Description: The Return of the Holy Family from Egypt; with the Virgin Mary and Joseph on either side of the Christ Child, Joseph leading the donkey, in a rocky landscape. 1523 Pen and brown ink, with grey wash, over black chalk
Curator's comments: Eighteen drawings of this size by the artist are known, depicting Old and New Testament subjects. Most are dated 1523 and all are probably from the same set of designs. Their purpose is not known. The subject is rare, and usually occurs as part of a narrative cycle. Literature: Vasari Society, VIII 19; Timothy B. Husband, 'The Luminous Image' exh. cat., New York (Metropolitan Museum) 1995, no.70.
Bibliographic references: Popham (D & F) 1932 / Dutch and Flemish drawings of the XV and XVI centuries (2)
Exhibition history: 1973, BM, Netherlandish prints and drawings (no cat.) 1995 June-July, New York, Met Mus of Art, 'Painted Glass Roundel', no. 70 2003-4 Dec-April, BM, NACF exhibition
